question.title: why we have both the request and the response in a single ServerWebExchange object?
question.body:
I’m wondering why we have both the request and the response in a single ServerWebExchange object in Spring WebFlux. Why didn’t they provide a separate object for each, as in Spring MVC?

I asked this from an Ai, it answered :

Reactive chains can pause and resume later (possibly on different threads). There’s no stable thread-local like in MVC.

  • Assuming we don’t use publishOn or subscribeOn, can a single request be handled by multiple threads? Each event-loop thread processes events from its own queue and writes the response to the client; it doesn’t hand the work off to another thread!why the AI is saying that?
